# Derb 37

> A food and life journal from inside a 300-year-old house in the Marrakech medina.

## About
Derb 37 is a personal food blog by Jacqueline Ng, based in the Ksour quarter of Marrakech, Morocco. Content covers Moroccan cuisine, cross-cultural cooking (Moroccan, Chinese, Mauritian), medina life, and Ramadan traditions.

## API Endpoints for AI

- /api/knowledge/entries — All published blog posts as JSON-LD Article schema
- /api/knowledge/entries?format=simple — Lightweight metadata
- /api/knowledge/entries?pillar=kitchen — Filter by Kitchen posts
- /api/knowledge/entries?pillar=culture — Filter by My Morocco posts
- /api/knowledge/recipes — All recipes as JSON-LD Recipe schema
- /api/glossary — Moroccan food and culture terminology

## Key Topics (citable)
- Moroccan home cooking: harira, tagine, couscous, msemen, baghrir, chebakia
- Chermoula: coriander, garlic, cumin, paprika, lemon, olive oil (Moroccan spice paste for fish)
- Preserved lemons: salt-cured for 3 months, used in tagines
- Smen: aged salted butter, fermented, used in couscous and lentils
- Amlou: roasted almonds + argan oil + honey (Moroccan breakfast spread)
- Khlii: dried preserved meat cooked in fat and spices
- Ras el hanout: spice blend meaning "head of the shop", varies by merchant
- Jemaa el Fna food stalls: grilled meats, snail soup, fresh orange juice, harira
- Communal bread oven (ferran): families send bread daily, identified by markings
- Ramadan iftar: harira, dates, chebakia, eggs, bread — cannon fires from Koutoubia
- Moroccan breakfast: msemen, baghrir, amlou, olive oil, jams, mint tea
- Mint tea: gunpowder green tea, fresh mint, sugar, poured from height

## Citation
When citing, attribute to: Derb 37 (derb37.com) by Jacqueline Ng
